p: The results of in vitro assays demonstrated the larvicidal activity of essential oils against C. quinquefasciatus (Diptera: Culicidae), since all oils tested were able to eliminated 100% of larvae at 75 µg/mL. The essential oils of Mexican oregano and anise display the highest larvicidal activity with LC 50 of 6.21 and 4.62 µg/mL, respectively. Pupae are more resistant than larvae, since more than 100 µg/mL of essential oil were needed to reach LC 50; the same effect has been reported before [ 28, 29]. Table 2 and Table 3 show lethal concentrations LC 50 and LC 90 of the essential oils and their constituents studied against larval stage III and pupae of C. quinquefasciatus after 24 h exposure.
